Package nl.uu.cs.aplib.agents

Class AutonomousBasicAgent

java.lang.Object
nl.uu.cs.aplib.mainConcepts.BasicAgent
nl.uu.cs.aplib.agents.AutonomousBasicAgent
Direct Known Subclasses:
TestAgent
public class AutonomousBasicAgent extends BasicAgent
An extension of BasicAgent that can be run as autonomous agents. Agents of this class moreover have the ability to send messages to other agents. Do note that an AutonomousBasicAgent requires a state of type State .
Author:
Wish

  • Constructor Details

    • AutonomousBasicAgent

      public AutonomousBasicAgent()
      Create a plain instance of AutonomousBasicAgent. To be useful you will need to add few other things to it, e.g. a state and a goal.

    • AutonomousBasicAgent

      public AutonomousBasicAgent​(String id, String role)
      Create a plain instance of AutonomousBasicAgent with the given id and role. To be useful you will need to add few other things to it, e.g. a state and a goal.

  • Method Details

    • registerTo

      public AutonomousBasicAgent registerTo​(ComNode comNode)
      Register this agent to the given ComNode. Agents need to register to a ComNode first before it is able to send to or receive messages from other agents. The method returns this agent itself, so that it can be used in the Fluent Interface style.

    • setGoal

      public AutonomousBasicAgent setGoal​(GoalStructure g)
      Description copied from class: BasicAgent
      Set a goal for this agent. The method returns the agent itself so that this method can be used in the Fluent Interface style.

    • attachState

      public AutonomousBasicAgent attachState​(State state)

    • setSamplingInterval

      public AutonomousBasicAgent setSamplingInterval​(long interval)
      Set the agent sampling interval in ms. The method returns this agent itself, so that it can be used in the Fluent Interface style.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      If the agent is already running autonomously, invoking this method will cause it to pause. While it is paused, it will not trigger any tick. User resume() to make the agent resuming its autonomous run. An incoming message will also cause the agent to resume.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      If this agent is sleeping (e.g. while waiting until it is time to do its next tick), and it was paused (was called, this method will cause the agent to resume its work.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      If the agent is running autonomously, this command will cause the agent to stop its run. This command will not interrupt the agent if it is currently executing an Action. Once the execution of the Action is finished, the agent will respond to this stop command, causing it to exit its autonomous loop.

    • sendMsgToThisAgent

      public void sendMsgToThisAgent​(Message m)
      This will send a message to this agent. Invoking this method will cause the agent to be awaken from its sleep, or if it was paused, it will be unpaused/resumed. Normally this method is called by a ComNode to send a message to this agent on behalf of another agent. However, since this method is public, whatever the application around this agent can also use it to directly send a message to this agent.

    • waitUntilTheGoalIsConcluded

      public GoalStructure waitUntilTheGoalIsConcluded()
      When this is called, the calling thread will be paused until the current goal-tree is concluded (which can be either with success or as fail). The method will return the goal-tree.

    • loop

      public void loop()
      This will run the agent in an infinite loop. The idea is to run this in a new thread, e.g. as in: 
       new Thread(() -> agent.loop()).start();
      The above code essentially cause the agent to run autonomously. If there is no goal however, this method will pause, until there is one. Then, it will proceed by invoking update() periodically. The time between update is specified by the field samplingInterval. The agent will strive to keep the sampling interval around that specified time, but it does not commit to keep it accurately. If given a goal, and if after sometime the goal is solved (or failed), the agent will detach the goal. If there are other threads that called waitUntilTheGoalIsConcluded(), these will first be awaken. Then this method launch() will sleep again, waiting for a new goal, and the above cycle repeats again. There are methods in this class to command the agent to pause, to resume again, and to stop all together.
